articles.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
articles.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

articles.title: Florida Revives Bitcoin Reserve Push With New 2026 Bill
articles.description:
Bitcoin Magazine

Florida Revives Bitcoin Reserve Push With New 2026 Bill
Florida lawmakers filed new legislation for the 2026 session that would create a state-run crypto reserve after a similar effo

articles.title: Tokenized Brazilian credit card debt offers 13% yield through BlackOpal's GemStone platform
articles.description: The initiative leverages the Plume Network to tokenize credit card receivables, while giving merchants immediate access to cash.

articles.title: China’s interest-bearing digital yuan piles pressure on US stablecoin rules
articles.description: China’s move to pay interest on the digital yuan is colliding with the GENIUS Act’s ban on stablecoin yields, intensifying questions over whether US digital dollars can remain competitive.

articles.title: Crypto Liquidations Top $477M as Bitcoin Slips Below $90K
articles.description: Bitcoin’s dip below $90,000 has triggered a liquidation spree as bullish momentum fades amid ETF outflows and thin liquidity.

articles.title: Memecoins, DeFi lead declines as caution seeps in: Crypto Daybook Americas
articles.description: Your day-ahead look for Jan. 8, 2026

articles.title: Crypto Derivatives Market Reset After Oct. 10 Crash: BitMEX
October's crypto crash left market makers stuffed with coins, slowing trading: BitMEX
articles.description: BitMEX's annual report details the impact of the Oct crash on market liquidity, basis trades and other key issues.

articles.title: Bybit’s Private Wealth Management delivered 20% returns amid a challenging 2025
articles.description: Bybit’s top performing fund saw returns of 20.3% APR driven by the exchange’s flagship high-yield USDT-based strategies.

articles.title: BitMine buys $105M Ether to kick off 2026, still holds $915M in cash
articles.description: The largest corporate ETH holder started 2026 with a $105 million Ether purchase, while surpassing $2.87 billion in staked Ether, seeking to generate passive yield on its holdings.

articles.title: India tax authorities warn crypto undermines tax enforcement
articles.description: Officials told a parliamentary panel that private wallets, offshore exchanges and cross-border DeFi activity make tracking taxable crypto income difficult.

articles.title: Solana Accelerate to open Consensus Hong Kong in February
articles.description: CoinDesk and the Solana Foundation said the developer event will kick off Consensus Hong Kong on Feb. 11, setting the tone for a week focused on builders, capital, and policymakers.

articles.title: AI giant Anthropic raising $10B at $350B valuation: Report
articles.description: Claude maker Anthropic is aiming to nearly double its valuation to $350 billion, with The Wall Street Journal reporting a planned $10 billion raise.

articles.title: GENIUS Act changes would be a ‘national security trap’: Crypto execs
articles.description: Pro-crypto lawyer John Deaton argued that banning yield on stablecoins would incentivize the use of China’s interest-bearing digital yuan, hurting the US dollar.

articles.title: Crypto credit is starting to look like cash savings accounts: Asia Morning Briefing
articles.description: Flowdesk says record demand met even deeper liquidity, suppressing volatility across staking, stablecoin lending, making crypto credit markets look more like traditional cash plumbing.

articles.title: Trump-backed World Liberty Financial seeks US bank charter to bring USD1 stablecoin fully onshore
articles.description: The DeFi protocol said WLTC Holdings LLC filed an application to establish a national trust bank purpose-built for stablecoin operations.

articles.title: Elon Musk: Nvidia’s Self-Driving Tech Is Still Years From Challenging Tesla
articles.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk argued that Nvidia’s software has arrived years earlier than legacy automakers can deploy it at scale.

articles.title: Polymarket Begins Rolling Out Fees in US App and Crypto Markets
Wyoming's 'Frontier' Stablecoin Debuts—Will It Offer Yield?
articles.description: The Wyoming Frontier Stable Token is now available to the public, four months after its official launch.

articles.title: Babylon receives $15M from a16z Crypto to expand Bitcoin-native lending
articles.description: The investment was made through the purchase of BABY tokens to support the development of Babylon’s trustless Bitcoin collateral infrastructure.

articles.title: Clone-X NFTs Soar 200% as Nike Sells RTFKT
Crypto Markets Edge Lower as Investors Weigh Macro Data
Iran Accepting Crypto Payments for Weapons—But This May Not Help It Evade Sanctions
articles.description: Iran’s Mindex website offers military equipment for purchase, with its FAQ now saying that buyers can contract to pay in crypto.

articles.title: Wyoming Launches First U.S. State-Issued Stablecoin
Upexi targets higher-yield Solana treasury strategy for 2026 as holdings near 2.2 million SOL
articles.description: Upexi continues to add SOL and reduce its share count through buybacks and insider purchases despite weak equity performance.

articles.title: A16z Crypto buys $15 million in BABY tokens to fund Babylon’s buildout of new BTCVaults
articles.description: Babylon's vaults allow native Bitcoin to be verifiably locked as collateral while remaining on the Bitcoin blockchain.

articles.title: J.P. Morgan’s Deposit Token to Be Issued Natively on Canton Network
Morgan Stanley widens crypto bet with proposed spot Ethereum ETF after Bitcoin and Solana filings
articles.description: Morgan Stanley has filed with the SEC for a spot Ethereum ETF that includes staking exposure hours after submitting BTC and SOL ETF filings.

articles.title: US Bankers Warn Stablecoin Yield Workarounds Threaten Local Lending
articles.description: Industry figures argued that banks’ concerns are valid but exaggerated, urging the creation of comparable rules without stifling innovation.

articles.title: Bitcoin Dips to $92K as Liquidations Top $440M
articles.description: Bitcoin has slipped from highs near $94,000 as selling pressure returned, exposing the rally’s thin leverage despite improving liquidity.
